CatDescriptText: Robert Kenneweg, state investigator, Millvale and Virginia Townsend, housewife, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 9, 1960, pg. 29 with question "Do you believe the moral standards of our community have deteriorated since World War II?"  Mr. Kenneweg's answer reads: "TI think they are worse...If I knew why they are worse, I could make a fortune.  I guess laxity in the home is the primary reason."  Mrs. Townsend's answer reads: "Worse to a very large extent."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Robert Kenneweg wearing hat, eyeglasses, and striped suit jacket, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Virginia Townsend wearing light colored head scarf and double breasted corduroy jacket standing in front of the Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
